means: <俗>将死者，落魄的人，无望的人

sentence.Network_en: She fell so heavily I thought she was a goner.
sentence.Network_cn: 她这一跤跌得这么重，我想是救不过来了。

sentence.Network_en: When his parachute failed he thought he was a goner.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的降落伞打不开了,他想他算完了.

sentence.Network_en: With the old man goner the Family power is cut at least in halt.
sentence.Network_cn: 老头子一死,咱家族的实力就等于砍掉了一半.

entry.tran: 垂死的人；无法挽救的人
entry.def: If you say that someone is a goner, you mean that they are about to die, or are in such danger that nobody can save them.

example.ex: She fell so heavily I thought she was a goner.
example.tran: 她这一跤跌得这么重，我想是救不过来了。

means.word_mean: 1. a person in desperate straits; someone doomed;

sentences.sentence: "I'm a goner if this plan doesn't work"

auth_sentence.content: I plunged in and swam to his rescue. He was a goner when I reached him.
auth_sentence.res_content: I plunged in and swam to his rescue. He was a goner when I reached him.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I plunged in and swam to his rescue. He was a goner when I reached him.

auth_sentence.content: The minute he walked into a room and smiled at me, I was a goner.
auth_sentence.res_content: The minute he walked into a room and smiled at me, I was a goner.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The minute he walked into a room and smiled at me, I was a goner.
